body:
Im getting a gaming mouse.  Nuff said.

I dont care about price.
 I only want a nice, comfortable, (Slightly affordable :P Nothing over 100$) mouse, I would also like it to be able to click really well and improve my pvp WITH side buttons.
                  Thanks!  -Raven

title: What gaming mouse should I get?

replies.body: I would go for a Logitech gaming mouse, possibly the g500 or g502. Both are very capable mice. I would not go for razer branded mice.
replies.body_tagged: I would go for a Logitech gaming mouse, possibly the g500 or g502. Both are very capable mice. I would not go for razer branded mice.

replies.body:
Get The Razer Naga 2014 edition.
it's The Best (in my opinion).

replies.body: Razerdeathadder 2013
replies.body_tagged: Razerdeathadder 2013

replies.body:
I would say Razer Deathadder, it costs $79.99 on the offical Razer website but on Amazon you can get it $61.57

Razer: http://www.razerzone.com/ca-en/gaming-mice/razer-deathadder

Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Razer-DeathAdder-Ergonomic-Gaming-Mouse/dp/B00AAS888S/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1401655700&sr=8-1&keywords=Razer+Deathadder

The Razer Deathadder is what I have and it is one of the best mice you could get your hands on. It is compatible with Windows and it is also compatible with Macs. It comes with it's own software called Razer Synapse 2.0. and on there you can change the settings and create macros etc. Macros are against server rules so don't use them. But Razer Synapse saves all your settings to the cloud on your created account. The Razer Deathadder is a very good mouse and it is in the "The top 10" for most owned gaming mice. It is an award winning gaming mouse and it is in a price range of below $100. All in all this mouse is really effective and effecient and I was really happy when I got one for my birthday, more suprised then happy. If you get this mouse then I hope you have fun as Razer is a really good company for gaming.

Thank you for reading this reply.
~ Splade
